I wanted to pull my rook to c8, but I just noticed my that opponent missed:  
10.	b4 attacks my bishop on c5, so I must retreat to d6, but
11.	b5 and Bishop and Knight are forked!
moves.10... Bxe2: Bxe2 obviates the problem, but now my opponent can lift his Rook to e2.
moves.11. Qxe2:
Or his Queen.  

I would like to advance my d pawn and attack his knight, but that would open the gate for his light Bishop to take my c6 Knight!  I must eliminate the danger to my c6 Knight and my a8 Rook!
moves.12. Rd1 Qd6 13. e4 d4: I like to bypass and advance.
moves.18... Bxd6 19. e5: Too little too late?  No!  My h5 Knight is trapped!  What an imaginative fork!
moves.20... Rxc6 21. Nxa7 Rxc2 22. b4:
Now what?  

I should probably free my trapped Knight.
moves.24. Rdf1:
I see no method to his madness...

I should probably take the lead and play f6.
moves.24... f6 25. exf6: I'm thinking to recapture with Nf6, with with Nc3 my goal.
moves.25... Nxf6 26. Rad1: I just now noticed my undefended e6 Pawn!  Maybe I can turn the error into a sacrifice.  (Hope springs eternal)
moves.26... Ne4 27. Rfe1: X-ray attack - Knight and Pawn both in jeopardy.
moves.28... d2 29. Re2: Excellent!  Rc1 should be the beginning of the end...
